description:
PSA: This Course will no longer be available June 30th 2016 onwards
                            Coursera announced that they will be shutting off their old platform on June 30th. Over  400 courses that are part
                                of the old stack will be no longer be available. You can find the  complete list here.
                            
                            

                            
                                Read this guide to learn how to download this course before the old platform shuts down. 

                                The guide provides two ways to download the courses - Chrome Plugin and Python Script. Depending on which method you use, check the appropriate sections below for further details.
                            
                            
                            
                                To download this course you need to be enrolled in the course.
                                                                Unfortunately this course is closed for enrollment to new students. If you hadn't signed up before, you will not be able to download the course.
                                

                                                            

                            Chrome Plugin

                                                                If you had signed up for this course you will be able to download and save the course materials using the chrome plugin. Click on Go To Class and Log in to your Coursera account to do so.
                            
                            Python Script
                            
                                                                For the python script to work you will need a class name. Pick one from below:
                                                                    latinmigration-001
                                
                                
                                If more than one class name below, pick the last one. If the script fails, pick the one above that and try again. Not all of these class names are guranteed to work.


                            






                        
                    
                    This six-week-long graduate level course is targeted primarily to in-service teachers in US schools. Its main purpose is to give P-12 teachers opportunities to develop new knowledge and understanding of Latin America in the context of migration, and of the historical, sociocultural, and economic forces that cause Latin Americans to leave home for the United States. Six specialists from several disciplines will discuss these topics from different perspectives.Students will develop strategies to enhance the educational experience of their students by incorporating content and new insights on Latin America into their teaching.All lectures and instructional materials developed for this course by the Ohio State University are licensed under the Creative Commons AttributionNonCommercial-ShareAlike 4.0 International License. To view a copy of this license, visit http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-nc-sa/4.0/

                                            Syllabus
                        Week One: Transnational Migration and Global DiasporasInstructor - Abril TrigoWeek Two: US Immigration Policies and Latin American ImmigrationInstructor - Lilia FernándezWeek Three: Contemporary Latin American Migration
Instructor - Jeff CohenWeek Four: Latino/a Cultures in the USA 
Instructor - Frederick AldamaWeek Five: Immigrant Health
Instructor - Reanne FrankWeek Six: Language and Literacy: Multilingualism and Education 
Instructor - Marcia Farr
title: Latin American Migration
